disobedience.question: When frustrated with members within my community, did I reject the unity of the Catholic Church?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did you intentionally skip prescribed days of fasting, such as Ash Wednesday?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

extracted_data_phrases: for the dignity of the human body
disobedience.question: Did I condone a funeral where a loved one's remains were not buried, thereby showing disrespect for the dignity of the human body?
disobedience.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

disobedience.question: Did I speak disrespectfully about the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

extracted_data_phrases: from staying away from Sacraments or Mass

condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: by avoiding difficult conversations , potentially hindering their spiritual growth and development

condoning.description: Permitting a child to continue in error by avoiding difficult conversations is sinful because it neglects our God-given parental duty to guide and form our children's moral and spiritual development, placing our own comfort above their eternal wellbeing.

condoning.question: Did I permit my child to be exposed to bad influences?
condoning.description: Parents have to protect their children's well-being, guarding them from harmful elements that could damage their faith or lead them into sin.

infidelity.description: For Catholics, marriage is sacramental and needs to occur in the Church or receive a dispensation if either people are not Catholic.

uncharity.question: Do I turn away from those who are homeless?

uncharity.question: Have I ever spoken or acted in ways that disrespect others, treating them as less than children of God?

extracted_data_phrases: especially in situations where I felt frustrated or inconvenienced

uncharity.question: Did I fail to show practical kindness and care to someone who was ill, especially when they needed it most?

incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Have I allowed myself to indulge excessively in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable, leading me away from temperance?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking, indulging in sensual pleasures to an excessive degree?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking in ways that compromised your physical or spiritual well-being, such as during social gatherings or special occasions?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

especially in casual conversations with friends and acquaintances
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true, especially in casual conversations with friends and acquaintances?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in speaking ill of someone's private affairs, even if what was shared was true?
